name: Kukri-Cutter Rogue: Fighter 12 / Rogue 19 / Weapon Master 7
author: EasternPromises

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
Good afternoon glorious optimizers,

I have a build I've been trying to get off the ground. I wanted it all: Sneak attack, 7 attacks per round, all the rogue skills, and crits all over the place. I also wanted it to not care too much about crit immune enemies, able to leverage pure STR to bring them down. This originally started out as a halfling but I wanted to add KD and IKD plus one more skill so human was chosen, however I still have the halfling version around.

This build is heavily inspired from similar works by Mick, Valerfor, and Max though I like to brag that I at least came up with the leveling order before trolling for pointers.

Biggest downside: Bad saves. UMD and Clarity will be in use always.

posts.author: Mirnaia
posts.content:
Looks nice!
You only need 40 Tumble. Beyond the 15 required for in-combat movement without getting AoO'd, only the actual ranks matter for AC, not any modifiers.
What's your idea about armour choice? A STR build calls for the heaviest you can find, the epic sneaking calls for light armour, but then… oh wait, if you can cap DEX (or at least put 11 points into it for the +8 bonus at 26 DEX) you're as protected with UMD monk robes as with plate armour. Was that your plan? What about while getting there?
I would swap Blind Fight and KD. At 1 APR (and in Expertise) you're not going to be using it, while blind fighting might help you.
Search is probably too high. I don't know the exact figures, but unless you're going to PvP or be in a module that has some very fancy custom traps, you need less. Then again, if you're going to PvP, no amount of Search is adequate.
Spellcraft would be lovely, even if x-classed, but I don't see what to drop for it (even if you drop Search ranks.)

Any caster will need to be taken seriously, you pretty much can't afford a single non-direct damage spell hitting you. A fight featuring more than one caster enemy will need a solid plan pre-engagement. That said, the nemesis of these kinds of builds is the spellcasting dracolich. Since you can't set traps, but do have UMD, it's hide behind the corner and bait as many spells as possible with summons time. Against anything that isn't a high level caster+sneak/crit immune+true seer the build should rock.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I really like the name!

What Mirnaia said, also you might want to slightly alter the split to Ftr(14)/ Rogue(17)/ WM(7) in order to take IKD with one of your Ftr(14) bonus feats & then invest that general feat to an Epic save.

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
Thanks guys, I'll rearrange some things.

Armor would be determined by the dexterity items I find. Heaviest I think would be chain shirt and by the end padded armor/robes with enough dex buffs.

I did use rogue bonus feats for ESF: Hide and MS to offset some ACP, I even planned to take ESF: Spellcraft if I would drop a skill :) but that would mean I could not take rogue levels lower than 19 like Valerfor suggested.

Dropping down Search, UMD, and 2 ranks from tumble might be worth it for spellcraft. Does anyone know the most search you really need for epic traps? I don't think the PW I play right now (Blackstone Keep) really upped the search DC any further than base.

And I honestly have no plan for super casters. I have enough STR to deal consistent damage but I need a way not to get targeted... maybe buddy up with a DD? Where's anti-magic field when you need it???

posts.author: revolucas
posts.content:
Detect DC is listed here: http://nwn.wikia.com/wiki/Set_trap

As you can see, someone with 43 Set Traps skill can have undetectable traps, since they reach well over 86.

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content: Appreciate that, any clue around what search and disable I would need for non pvp traps? Assuming the module is fairly standard

posts.author: Mirnaia
posts.content: The answer is on this very forum, I was just being lazy :) OK, so if you're a rogue and therefore can actually detect epic traps, it seems you need 42 modified Search ranks to detect the most difficult trap on your first try. Not many points saved there.

posts.content: Oh wow! I was definitely using the wrong search terms. I will pour over this guide.
